column1: # --- Fernando Pessoa (English renderings) ---
Everything is worthwhile if the soul is not small.
I am the size of what I see.
I carry within me all the dreams of the world.
To live is not necessary; to create is necessary.
To be great, be whole: nothing of yours exaggerate or exclude.
All that sleeps is a child again.
# --- Tao Te Ching (Laozi) ---
A journey of a thousand miles begins beneath one’s feet.
Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
The soft overcomes the hard; the gentle overcomes the rigid.
# --- Stoics ---
You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
What stands in the way becomes the way.
Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
No man is free who is not master of himself.
It is not things themselves that disturb us, but our judgments about them.
We suffer more in imagination than in reality.
Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
# --- Heraclitus / Presocratics ---
No man ever steps in the same river twice.
Character is destiny.
The way up and the way down are one and the same.
# --- Sun Tzu ---
In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
Victorious warriors win first and then go to war.
# --- Emerson / Thoreau / Pascal / Wilde / Confucius / Shakespeare ---
What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
Our life is frittered away by detail—simplify, simplify.
All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone.
Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves.
Brevity is the soul of wit.
There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
